ygData.subject: Re: Good loot
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Kill Gnolls (cash and items), kill any Skeleton with a weapon in hands. I can make about a PP in an hour. ... Kerra might be hard for you at your level.
ygData.messageBody:
According to Philippe Fuentes:
> I'm and Erudit , I reached lvl 8 yesterday and I can't buy any spell lvl 3
> cause I miss money. Everything I kill don't give me enough money.
> I'm hunting around Queynos Hill, BB, West Karana and I barely reach 60
> gold in bank, I really don't see how to make more money and lvl 3 spells
> are something like 4 or 5 platinum.

Kill Gnolls (cash and items), kill any Skeleton with a weapon in hands.
I can make about a PP in an hour.

> can you give me any advice on how to make more money disgarding XP for now.
> I was told the Kerra Islan is a good place so I made the trip back to erudin
> but I couldn't find anybody in the Island and nobody at Erudin to organize a
> group to the Island. It seems like nobody knows Kerra ...

Kerra might be hard for you at your level. The Wisps are a gold mine (they
have a random amount of cash on them, up to 3g once, and carry
lightstones ~1pp and greater lightstones ~4pp at times). But the Kerran
wisps range from level 10 to 12, and can only be hit by magic weapons.
Get a mage to summon you a dagger before hunting.

Otherwise, it IS a perfect spot. I spent 6 hours of playtime at level 13
there, and made it to level 14, with 45pp in bank. I know a friend who stayed
there for level 14, when about 1/3 of the wisps became green, and he left
at level 15 with over 100pp in bank.

Up to three players, you can set a good rotation on the main wisp spawn
point (cycle of 4 wisps). Don't camp the 2nd point, if you can find it
(spawns 1 wisp during the same cycle). But it's a boring activity.
Once, I had the entire zone for me. I couldn't even kill wisps fast enough
and I died once when I got three of them (deep blue "risky") on me.

Bring a cleric and a good party with you and you can hunt the zombie sailors
(weapons).

Note that I doubt the Kerran will regard you amiably, however :)

--
